restricted to anyone with the link (`open`), only people
within the company (`company`) and only those who
have been invited to the folder (`collaborators`).

This field defaults to the `default` access level,
which is the access level as specified by the
enterprise admin.

The `company` access level is only available to paid
accounts.

password.description:
The password required to access the shared link. Set the
password to `null` to remove it.

A password can only be set when `access` is set to `open`.

unshared_at.description:
The timestamp at which this shared link will
be disabled. This field can only be set by
users with paid accounts.

can_download.description:
If the shared link allows for downloading of files.
This can only be set when `access` is set to
`open` or `company`.

MetadataPatchItem.title: Metadata Patch Item
MetadataPatchItem.description:
A [JSON-Patch](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) operation for a
change to make to the metadata.

path.description:
The location in the metadata JSON object
to apply the changes to, in the format of a
[JSON-Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

The path must always be prefixed with a `/`.

Special characters `~` and `/` in the key must be escaped
to ensure the operation can be executed as intended.

value.description:
The value to be set or tested.

Required for `add`, `replace`, and `test` operations.

For `add`, if the value exists already the previous value will be
overwritten by the new value.

For `replace`, the value must exist before replacing.

For `test`, the existing value at the `path` location must match
the specified value.

from.description:
Required for `move` or `copy`.

The location in the metadata JSON object to move or copy from,
in the format of a
[JSON-Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

FolderUploadEmail.description: The writable Folder Upload Email object

access.description:
When this parameter has been set, users can email files
to the email address that has been automatically
created for this folder.

To create an email address, set this property either when
creating or updating the folder.

When set to `collaborators`, only emails from registered email

When set to `open` it will accept emails from any email

MetadataTemplate.title: Metadata Template
MetadataTemplate.description: A template for metadata that can be applied to files and folders

id.description: The ID of the template

MetadataTemplatePatchItem.title: Metadata Template Patch Item
MetadataTemplatePatchItem.description:
A patch operation for the
changes to make to the metadata template.

The possible operations are as follows.

* `addEnumOption` Adds an enum option at the
  end of the enum option list for the specified `fieldKey`.

  Example `{"op":"addEnumOption","fieldKey":"category",
  "data":{"key":"New Option"}}`

* `addField` Adds a field at the end of the field list
  for the template.

  Example `{"op":"addField","data":{"displayName":"Category",
  "key":"category","hidden":false,"type":"string"}}`.

* `editTemplate` Allows for editing the base properties
  of a template, mainly the `displayName` and `hidden`
  properties.

  Example `{"op":"editTemplate","data":{"displayName":"Client"}}`.

* `reorderEnumOptions` Reorders the enum option list to
  match the requested enum option list.

  Example `{"op":"reorderEnumOptions","fieldKey":"category",
  "enumOptionKeys":["option2","option1","option3"]}`

* `reorderFields`  Reorders the field list to match the requested
  field list

  Example `{"op":"reorderFields","fieldKeys":["field2","field1","field3"]}`

The following changes can affect existing instances of this template.

* `editField` Edits any number of the base properties of a field, mainly
  the `displayName`, `hidden`, `description`, and `key` properties.

  If the key is changed, existing values of the specified field are
  migrated to the new key. Search indexes are updated, which can take
  time depending on how many files are affected by the change.

  Example `{"op":"editField","fieldKey":"category",
  "data":{"displayName":"Customer Group"}}`

* `editEnumOption` Edits one of the options of an enum field.

  Example `{"op":"editEnumOption","fieldKey":"years","enumOptionKey":"2011",
  "data":{"key":"2020"}}`

* `removeEnumOption` Removes the specified enum option from the
  specified enum field.

  Example `{"op":"removeEnumOption","fieldKey":"years",
  "enumOptionKey":"2011"}`

* `removeField` Removes the specified field from the template.

  Example `{"op":"removeField","fieldKey":"brand"}`

op.description: The operation type to perform on the template.

data.description: The data for the operation. Can vary depending on the operation.

fieldKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple fields, the keys of the
fields to be affected.

enumOptionKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple enum options,
the keys of the enum options to be affected.

MetadataTemplate--Writable.title: Metadata Template (Writable)
MetadataTemplate--Writable.description:
The writable parts of a metadata template that can be
applied to files and folders

scope.description:
The scope of the object. `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are supported.

The `global` scope contains the template with a key of `properties`,
while the enterprise scope pertains to custom templates created within
the enterprise.

 The ID of the enterprise will be appended to the enterprise scope.

templateKey.description:
A unique identifier for the template. The identifier must be unique across
the scope of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being
applied.

displayName.description: The display name of the template

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

fields.description: The ordered set of key:value pairs for the template.

MetadataCascadePolicies.title: Metadata Cascade Policies
MetadataCascadePolicies.description: A list of metadata cascade policies.

MetadataCascadePolicy.title: Metadata Cascade Policy
MetadataCascadePolicy.description:
A cascade policy that applies to metadata policy template
to a folder

id.description: The ID of the metadata cascade policy object

owner_enterprise.description: The enterprise that owns the policy.

id.description: The ID of the enterprise that owns the policy.

parent.description: Represent the folder the policy is applied to

id.description: The ID of the folder the policy is applied to

scope.description:
The scope of the target instance that will be cascaded down. The `scope`
and `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the folder that is
to be cascaded down. Today, only `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are
supported.

templateKey.description:
The template key of the target metadata template to cascade down.
The `scope` & `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the f
older that is to be cascaded down.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description:
Comments are messages created on files. Comments
can be made independently or created as responses to other
comments

tagged_message.description:
The string representing the comment text with
@mentions included. @mention format is @[id:username]
where `id` is user's Box ID and `username` is
their display name.

Collaboration.title: Collaboration
Collaboration.description:
Collaborations define access permissions for users and groups to files and
folders, similar to access control lists. A collaboration object grants a
user or group access to a file or folder with permissions defined by a
specific role.

allOf.description:
The file or folder to which access is granted. The field is
`null` when the collaboration `status` is `pending`.
The user or group that is granted access

invite_email.description:
The email address used to invite an unregistered collaborator, if
they are not a registered user.

expires_at.description:
When the collaboration will expire, or `null` if no expiration
date is set.

status.description: The status of the collaboration invitation.

acknowledged_at.description:
When the `status` of the collaboration object changed to
`accepted` or `rejected`

allOf.description: The user who created the collaboration object

created_at.description: When the collaboration object was created

modified_at.description: When the collaboration object was last modified

is_accepted.description:
Whether or not the terms of service have been accepted.  The
field is `null` when there is no terms of service required.

allOf.description:
The terms of service that must be accepted before the
collaboration can be accepted. The field is `null` when
there is no terms of service required.

enterprise_has_strong_password_required_.description:
Whether or not the enterprise that owns the content requires
a strong password to collaborate on the content.

user_has_strong_password.description:
Whether or not the user has a strong password set for their
account. The field is `null` when a strong password is not
required.

enterprise_has_two_factor_auth_enabled.description:
Whether or not the enterprise that owns the content requires
two-factor authentication to be enabled in order to
collaborate on the content.

user_has_two_factor_authentication_enabl.description:
Whether or not the user has two-factor authentication
enabled. The field is `null` when two-factor
authentication is not required.

Task.title: Task
Task.description:
Tasks allow for file-centric workflows in Box. Users can
create tasks on files and assign them to collaborators on
Box.

allOf.description: The file associated with the task

action.description:
The action the task assignee will be prompted to
do.

message.description: A message that will be included with the task

allOf.description:
A collection of task assignment objects
associated with the task

is_completed.description: Whether the task has been completed

allOf.description: The user who created the task

created_at.description: When the task object was created

completion_rule.description:
When a task is created with completion rule
"all_assignees" (default), the task will only
be considered completed when all assignees have
completed the task. When a task is created with
completion rule "any_assignee", the task will be
considered completed when one assignee has
completed the task.

TaskAssignment.title: Task Assignment
TaskAssignment.description: An assignment of a task to a file and user

allOf.description: The file the task has been assigned to
The user the task has been assigned to

message.description:
A message that will be included with this task
assignment

completed_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
completed

assigned_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
assigned

reminded_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
reminded

allOf.description: The user who assigned this task

Item.title: Item
Item.description: A generic mini representation of a file, folder, user or enterprise

allOf.description:
A numeric identifier that represents the most recent user event
that has been applied to this item.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint
to filter out user events that would have occurred before this
identifier was read.

A simple example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this item. Used with If-Match headers.
May be `null` for some folders such as root or trash.

name.description: The name of the item.

WebLink.title: Web Link
WebLink.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

allOf.description: The parent object the web link belongs to

description.description:
The description accompanying the web link. This is
visible within the Box web application.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this link, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was created on Box’s servers.

modified_at.description:
When this file was last updated on the Box
servers.

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash.

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted.

allOf.description: The user who created this web link
The user who last modified this web link
The user who owns this web link

The shared link object for this item. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted

User.title: User
User.description:
A full representation of a user, as can be returned from any
user API endpoint.

tracking_codes.description:
Tracking codes allow an admin to generate reports from the
admin console and assign an attribute to a specific group
of users. This setting must be enabled for an enterprise
before it can be used.

can_see_managed_users.description: Whether the user can see other enterprise users in her contact list

is_sync_enabled.description: Whether the user can use Box Sync

is_external_collab_restricted.description:
Whether the user is allowed to collaborate with users outside her
enterprise

is_exempt_from_device_limits.description: Whether to exempt the user from Enterprise device limits

is_exempt_from_login_verification.description: Whether the user must use two-factor authentication

allOf.description: Representation of the user’s enterprise

my_tags.description:
Tags for all files and folders owned by the user. Values returned
will only contain tags that were set by the requester.

hostname.description:
The root (protocol, subdomain, domain) of any links that need to be
generated for the user

is_platform_access_only.description: Whether the user is an App User

external_app_user_id.description:
An external identifier for an app user, which can be used to look up
the user.

notification_email.description:
An alternate notification email address to which email
notifications are sent. When it's confirmed, this will be
the email address to which notifications are sent instead of
to the primary email address.

email.description: The email address to send the notifications to.

is_confirmed.description: Specifies if this email address has been confirmed.

EmailAlias.title: Email Alias
EmailAlias.description: An email alias for a user.

is_confirmed.description: Whether the email address has been confirmed

Invite.title: Invite
Invite.description: An invite for a user to an enterprise.

created_at.description: When the invite was created

Group.title: Group
Group.description:
Groups contain a set of users, and can be used in place of
users in some operations, such as collaborations.

provenance.description:
Keeps track of which external source this group is
coming from (e.g. "Active Directory", "Google Groups",
"Facebook Groups").  Setting this will
also prevent Box users from editing the group name
and its members directly via the Box web application.
This is desirable for one-way syncing of groups.

external_sync_identifier.description:
An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group. Example values of this field
could be an Active Directory Object ID or a Google
Group ID.  We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

description.description: Human readable description of the group.

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite the group to collaborate
on folders (Create Collaboration).

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can view the members of the group
(Get Memberships for Group).

* `admins_only` - the enterprise admin, co-admins, group's
  group admin
* `admins_and_members` - all admins and group members
* `all_managed_users` - all managed users in the
  enterprise

GroupMembership.title: Membership
GroupMembership.description:
Membership is used to signify that a user is part of a
group.

allOf.description: The user that the membership applies to
The group that the membership applies to

role.description: The role of the user in the group.

created_at.description: The time this membership was created.

modified_at.description: The time this membership was last modified.

target.description: The item that will trigger the webhook

id.description: The ID of the item to trigger a webhook

type.description: The type of item to trigger a webhook

allOf.description: The user who created the webhook

created_at.description:
A timestamp identifying the time that
the webhook was created.

address.description: The URL that is notified by this webhook

triggers.description:
An array of event names that this webhook is
to be triggered for

items.title: Webhook Trigger
items.description: The event name that triggered this webhook

MetadataCard.title: Metadata Card
MetadataCard.description:
A Box Skills card that is applied to the metadata
of a file.

created_at.description: The time the card was created at

skill_card_type.description: The type of card to create

skill.description: The skill that is updating the cards

id.description: The ID of the skill.

message.description: The actual title to show in the UI

invocation.description: The current invocation of the skill

id.description: The ID of the skill invocation.

status.description: Optional status. Used with a `card_type` of `status`.

code.description: The type of status being set

message.description: The message for the status to show in the UI

entries.description:
An optional list of entries.

Used with a `card_type` of`transcript`, `keyword` or
`timeline`.

duration.description:
An optional duration.

Used with a `card_type` of`transcript`, or
`timeline`.

RealtimeServers.title: Realtime Servers
RealtimeServers.description:
A list of real-time servers that can
be used for long-polling.

chunk_size.description: The number of pages of servers remaining.
The number of pages of events remaining.

next_stream_position.description:
The stream position of the start of the next page
of events.

RetentionPolicy.title: Retention Policy
RetentionPolicy.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can create retention
policies and then later assign them to specific folders
or their entire enterprise.  To use this feature, you must
have the manage retention policies scope enabled
for your API key via your application management console.

policy_type.description:
The type of the retention policy. A retention
policy type can either be `finite`, where a
specific amount of time to retain the content is known
upfront, or `indefinite`, where the amount of time
to retain the content is still unknown.

status.description:
The status of the retention policy. The status of
a policy will be `active`, unless explicitly retired by an
administrator, in which case the status will be `retired`.
Once a policy has been retired, it cannot become
active again.

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy

created_at.description: When the retention policy object was created

modified_at.description: When the retention policy object was last modified

NotifiedUser.title: Notified User
NotifiedUser.description: A user that is notified of an event.

type.description: The type of item to notify

id.description: The id of the user to notify

name.description: The name of the user to notify

login.description: The email address the user uses to notify

RetentionPolicyAssignments.title: Retention Policy Assignments
RetentionPolicyAssignments.description: A list of retention policy assignments

RetentionPolicyAssignment.title: Retention Policy Assignment
RetentionPolicyAssignment.description:
The retention policy assignment endpoint provides a way
for admins to apply a retention policy on a per-folder
basis, or place a blanket policy over the entire
enterprise.

allOf.description:
A mini retention policy object representing the
retention policy that has been assigned to this content

The `type` and `id` of the content that is under
retention. The `type` can either be `folder` or `
enterprise`.

A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy assignment object

assigned_at.description:
When the retention policy assignment object was
created

LegalHoldPolicies.title: Legal Hold Policies
LegalHoldPolicies.description: A list of legal hold policies.

LegalHoldPolicy.title: Legal Hold Policy
LegalHoldPolicy.description:
Legal Hold Policy information describes the basic
characteristics of the Policy, such as name, description,
and filter dates.

policy_name.description: Name of the legal hold policy.

description.description:
Description of the legal hold policy. Optional
property with a 500 character limit.

status.description:
* 'active' - the policy is not in a transition state
* 'applying' - that the policy is in the process of
  being applied
* 'releasing' - that the process is in the process
  of being released
* 'released' - the policy is no longer active

allOf.description: Counts of assignments within this policy by apply-to type
The user who created the legal hold policy object

created_at.description: When the legal hold policy object was created

modified_at.description:
When the legal hold policy object was modified.
Does not update when assignments are added or removed.

deleted_at.description:
When the policy release request was sent. (Because
it can take time for a policy to fully delete, this
isn't quite the same time that the policy is fully deleted).

If `null`, the policy was not deleted.

filter_started_at.description:
User-specified, optional date filter applies to
Custodian assignments only

filter_ended_at.description:
User-specified, optional date filter applies to
Custodian assignments only

release_notes.description: Optional notes about why the policy was created.

LegalHoldPolicyAssignments.title: Legal Hold Policy Assignments
LegalHoldPolicyAssignments.description: A list of legal hold policies assignments.

LegalHoldPolicyAssignment.title: Legal Hold Policy Assignment
LegalHoldPolicyAssignment.description:
Legal Hold Assignments are used to assign Legal Hold
Policies to Users, Folders, Files, or File Versions.

Creating a Legal Hold Assignment puts a hold
on the File-Versions that belong to the Assignment's
'apply-to' entity.

allOf.description:
The policy that the legal hold policy assignment
is part of

The item that the the legal hold policy
is assigned to. Includes type and ID.

The user who created the legal hold policy
assignment

assigned_at.description:
When the legal hold policy assignment object was
created

deleted_at.description:
When the assignment release request was sent.
(Because it can take time for an assignment to fully
delete, this isn't quite the same time that the
assignment is fully deleted). If null, Assignment
was not deleted.

FileVersionRetention.title: File Version Retention
FileVersionRetention.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can apply policies to
specified folders, or an entire enterprise. A file version retention
is a  record for a retained file version. To use this feature,
you must  have the manage retention policies scope enabled for your
API key via  your application management console. For more information
about retention policies, please visit our help documentation

allOf.description:
The file version this file version retention was
applied to
The file this file version retention was applied to

applied_at.description:
When this file version retention object was
created

disposition_at.description:
When the retention period expires on this file
version retention

allOf.description:
The winning retention policy applied to this file
version retention. A file version can have multiple
retention policies applied.

FileVersionRetentions.title: File Version Retentions
FileVersionRetentions.description: A list of file version retentions.

FileVersionLegalHold.title: File Version Legal Hold
FileVersionLegalHold.description:
File-Version-Legal-Hold is an entity representing all
holds on a File Version.

allOf.description: The file version that is held

The file for the file version held.
Note that there is no guarantee that the current
version of this file is held.

legal_hold_policy_assignments.description: List of assignments contributing to this Hold.

deleted_at.description:
Time that this File-Version-Legal-Hold was
deleted.

FileVersionLegalHolds.title: File Version Legal Holds
FileVersionLegalHolds.description: A list of file version legal holds.

DevicePinner.title: Device Pinner
DevicePinner.description:
Device pins allow enterprises to control what devices can
use native Box applications.

allOf.description: The user that the device pin belongs to

product_name.description: The type of device being pinned

created_at.description: The time the device pin was created

modified_at.description: The time the device pin was modified

TermsOfServices.title: Terms Of Services
TermsOfServices.description: A list of terms of services

TermsOfService.title: Terms Of Service
TermsOfService.description:
The root-level record that is supposed to represent a
single Terms of Service.

status.description: Whether these terms are enabled or not

allOf.description: The enterprise these terms apply to

tos_type.description: Whether to apply these terms to managed users or external users

text.description:
The text for your terms and conditions. This text could be
empty if the status is disabled

created_at.description: When the legal item was created

modified_at.description: When the legal item was modified.

TermsOfServiceUserStatuses.title: ToS User Statuses
TermsOfServiceUserStatuses.description: A list of terms of service user statuses

TermsOfServiceUserStatus.title: ToS User Status
TermsOfServiceUserStatus.description: The association between a Terms of Service and a user

allOf.description: The terms of service
The user

is_accepted.description: If the user has accepted the terms of services

created_at.description: When the legal item was created

modified_at.description: When the legal item was modified.

CollaborationWhitelistEntries.title: Collaboration Whitelist Entries
CollaborationWhitelistEntries.description: A list of collaboration whitelist entries.

CollaborationWhitelistEntry.title: Collaboration Whitelist Entry
CollaborationWhitelistEntry.description:
A Collaboration Whitelist entry describes an
approved domains that can collaborate with your enterprise

direction.description: The direction of the collaborations to whitelist

allOf.description: The enterprise this whitelist is applied to

created_at.description: The time the whitelist entry was created

CollaborationWhitelistExemptTargets.title: Whitelist Exempt Targets
CollaborationWhitelistExemptTargets.description: A list of collaboration whitelist exemptions.

CollaborationWhitelistExemptTarget.title: Whitelist Exempt Target
CollaborationWhitelistExemptTarget.description:
The record that represents a target user that is exempt from the
collaboration whitelist.

allOf.description: The enterprise this entry belongs to
The user that has been exempt

created_at.description: The time the entry was created

modified_at.description: The time the entry was modified

StoragePolicy.title: Storage Policy
StoragePolicy.description: The Storage Policy object describes the storage zone.

name.description: A descriptive name of the region

StoragePolicyAssignments.title: Storage Policy Assignments
StoragePolicyAssignments.description: A list of storage policy assignments.

StoragePolicyAssignment.title: Storage Policy Assignment
StoragePolicyAssignment.description: The assignment of a storage policy to a user or enterprise

allOf.description: The assigned storage policy
The enterprise or use the policy is assigned to

File--Standard.title: File (Standard)
File--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a file, as returned from any
file API endpoints by default

sha1.description:
The SHA1 hash of the file. This can be used to compare the contents
of a file on Box with a local file.

description.description: The optional description of this file

size.description:
The file size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer, it can
easily get very large and cause an integer overflow.

allOf.description:
The tree of folders that this file is contained in,
starting at the root.

created_at.description: The date and time when the file was created on Box.

modified_at.description: The date and time when the folder was last updated on Box.

trashed_at.description: The time at which this file was put in the trash.

purged_at.description:
The time at which this file is expected to be purged
from the trash.

content_created_at.description:
The date and time at which this file was originally
created, which might be before it was uploaded to Box.

content_modified_at.description:
The date and time at which this folder was last updated,
which might be before it was uploaded to Box.

allOf.description: The user who created this file
The user who last modified this file
The user who owns this file

The shared link for this file. This will be
`null` if no shared link has been created for this
file.
The folder that this file is located within.

item_status.description:
Defines if this item has been deleted or not.

* `active` when the item has is not in the trash
* `trashed` when the item has been moved to the trash but not deleted
* `deleted` when the item has been permanently deleted.

FilePermissions.title: File Permissions
FilePermissions.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for a file.

can_annotate.description: Specifies if the user can place annotations on this file.

can_comment.description: Specifies if the user can place comments on this file.

can_preview.description: Specifies if the user can preview this file.

can_upload.description: Specifies if the user can upload a new version of this file.

can_view_annotations_all.description: Specifies if the user view all annotations placed on this file

can_view_annotations_self.description:
Specifies if the user view annotations placed by themselves
on this file

Lock.title: Lock
Lock.description: The lock held on a file.

allOf.description: The use who created the lock

created_at.description: The time this lock was created at

expired_at.description: The time this lock is to expire at, which might be in the past

is_download_prevented.description: Whether or not the file can be downloaded while locked

url.description:
The actual expiring embed URL for this file, constructed
from the file ID and access tokens specified in this object.

WatermarkInfo.title: Watermark Info
WatermarkInfo.description: Details about the watermark applied to this item

is_watermarked.description: Specifies if this item has a watermark applied.

File--Mini.title: File (Mini)
File--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file, used when
nested under another resource.

allOf.description:
A numeric identifier that represents the most recent user event
that has been applied to this item.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint
to filter out user events that would have occurred before this
identifier was read.

A simple example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

name.description: The name of the file

FileVersion--Mini.title: File Version (Mini)
FileVersion--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested within another resource.

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of this version of the file.

Pagination.title: Pagination
Pagination.description: The part of an API response that describes pagination

total_count.description:
One greater than the offset of the last entry in the entire collection.
The total number of entries in the collection may be less than
`total_count`.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

offset.description:
The 0-based offset of the first entry in this set. This will be the same
as the `offset` query parameter.

order.description: The order by which items are returned

User--Mini.title: User (Mini)
User--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a user, used when
nested within another resource.

name.description: The display name of this user

login.description: The primary email address of this user

Folder--Standard.title: Folder (Standard)
Folder--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a folder, as returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

created_at.description:
The date and time when the folder was created. This value may
be `null` for some folders such as the root folder or the trash
folder.

modified_at.description:
The date and time when the folder was last updated. This value may
be `null` for some folders such as the root folder or the trash
folder.

allOf.description: The optional description of this folder

size.description:
The folder size in bytes.

Be careful parsing this integer as its
value can get very large.

allOf.description:
The tree of folders that this folder is contained in,
starting at the root.
The user who created this folder
The user who last modified this folder.

trashed_at.description: The time at which this folder was put in the trash.

purged_at.description:
The time at which this folder is expected to be purged
from the trash.

content_created_at.description:
The date and time at which this folder was originally
created.

content_modified_at.description: The date and time at which this folder was last updated.

expires_at.description: The time and which the folder will be automatically be deleted.

allOf.description: The user who owns this folder.

The shared link for this folder. This will be
`null` if no shared link has been created for this
folder.

access.description:
When this parameter has been set, users can email files
to the email address that has been automatically
created for this folder.

To create an email address, set this property either when
creating or updating the folder.

When set to `collaborators`, only emails from registered email
addresses for collaborators will be accepted. This includes
any email aliases a user might have registered.

When set to `open` it will accept emails from any email
address.

email.description: The optional upload email address for this folder.

allOf.description:
The optional folder that this folder is located within.

This value may be `null` for some folders such as the
root folder or the trash folder.

item_status.description:
Defines if this item has been deleted or not.

* `active` when the item has is not in the trash
* `trashed` when the item has been moved to the trash but not deleted
* `deleted` when the item has been permanently deleted.

allOf.description:
A page of the items that are in the folder.

This field can only be requested when querying a folder's
information, not when querying a folder's items.

FolderPermissions.title: Folder Permissions
FolderPermissions.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for a folder.

can_upload.description: Specifies if the user can upload into this folder.

Folder--Mini.title: Folder (Mini)
Folder--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested under another resource.

allOf.description:
A numeric identifier that represents the most recent user event
that has been applied to this item.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint
to filter out user events that would have occurred before this
identifier was read.

A simple example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

name.description: The name of the folder.

WebLink--Mini.title: Web Link (Mini)
WebLink--Mini.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

url.description: The URL this web link points to

allOf.description:
A numeric identifier that represents the most recent user event
that has been applied to this item.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint
to filter out user events that would have occurred before this
identifier was read.

A simple example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this web link. Used with `If-Match`
headers.

name.description: The name of the web link

MarkerPagination.title: Marker Pagination
MarkerPagination.description:
The part of an API response that describes marker
based pagination

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

next_marker.description: The marker for the start of the next page of results.

prev_marker.description: The marker for the start of the previous page of results.

MetadataTemplateField.title: Metadata Template Field
MetadataTemplateField.description:
An ordered set of key-value pairs that are part of a
metadata template

type.description: The data type of the field's value

key.description:
A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must
be unique within the template to which it belongs.

displayName.description: The display name of the field.

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

Comment--Standard.title: Comment (Standard)
Comment--Standard.description:
Standard representation of a comment, as returned by the
comment API endpoints and when nested within other resources.

is_reply_comment.description:
Whether or not this comment is a reply to another
comment

message.description: The text of the comment, as provided by the user

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the author of the
comment

created_at.description: The time this comment was created

modified_at.description: The time this comment was last modified

allOf.description: The object this comment was placed on

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description: The bare basic reference for an object

id.description: The unique identifier for this object

TermsOfService--Mini.title: Terms Of Service (Mini)
TermsOfService--Mini.description:
The root-level record that is supposed to represent a
single Terms of Service.

SharedLink.title: Shared Link
SharedLink.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box.

Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriately authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL that can be used to access the item on Box.

This URL will display the item in Box's preview UI where the file
can be downloaded if allowed.

This URL will continue to work even when a custom `vanity_url`
has been set for this shared link.

download_url.description:
A URL that can be used to download the file. This URL can be used in
a browser to download the file. This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

This property will be `null` for folders.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

access.description:
The access level for this shared link.

* `open` - provides access to this item to anyone with this link
* `company` - only provides access to this item to people the same company
* `collaborators` - only provides access to this item to people who are
   collaborators on this item

If this field is omitted when creating the shared link, the access level
will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link. This can be a more
restrictive access level than the value in the `access` field when the
enterprise settings restrict the allowed access levels.

effective_permission.description: The effective permissions for this shared link.

unshared_at.description:
The date and time when this link will be disabled. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Defines if the shared link requires a password to access the item.

permissions.description: Defines if this link allows a user to preview and download an item.

can_download.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be downloaded. For
shared links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

This value can be set to `true` when the effective access level is
set to `open` or `company`, not `collaborators`.

can_preview.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be previewed.

This value is always `true`. For shared links on folders this also
applies to any items in the folder.

download_count.description: The number of times this item has been downloaded.

preview_count.description: The number of times this item has been previewed.

User--Standard.title: User (Standard)
User--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a user, as returned from any
user API endpoints by default

created_at.description: When the user object was created

modified_at.description: When the user object was last modified

space_amount.description: The user’s total available space amount in bytes

space_used.description: The amount of space in use by the user

max_upload_size.description: The maximum individual file size in bytes the user can have

avatar_url.description: URL of the user’s avatar image

TrackingCode.title: Tracking Code
TrackingCode.description: Custom tracking code for a user.

name.description:
The name of the tracking code, which must be preconfigured in
the Admin Console

value.description: The value of the tracking code

Enterprise.title: Enterprise
Enterprise.description: A representation of a Box enterprise

name.description: The name of the enterprise

Group--Standard.title: Group (Standard)
Group--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a group, as returned from any
group API endpoints by default

created_at.description: When the group object was created

modified_at.description: When the group object was last modified

Group--Mini.title: Group (Mini)
Group--Mini.description:
Mini representation of a group, including id and name of
group.

name.description: The name of the group

MetadataCardEntry.title: Metadata Card Entry
MetadataCardEntry.description: An entry in the `entries` attribute of a metadata card

RealtimeServer.title: Realtime Server
RealtimeServer.description:
A real-time server that can be used for
long polling user events

ttl.description: he time in minutes for which this server is available

max_retries.description:
The maximum number of retries this server will
allow before a new long poll should be started by
getting a [new list of server](#options-events).

retry_timeout.description:
The maximum number of seconds without a response
after which you should retry the long poll connection.

This helps to overcome network issues where the long
poll looks to be working but no packages are coming
through.

Event.title: Event
Event.description: The description of an event that happened within Box

event_id.description: The ID of the event object. You can use this to detect duplicate events

allOf.description:
The user that performed the action represented by the event.
Some events may be performed by users not logged into Box.
In that case, not all attributes of the object are populated and the
event is attributed to a unknown user (`user_id = 2`)

allOf.title: Event Type
allOf.description: An event type that can trigger an event
The event type that triggered this event

session_id.description:
The session of the user that performed the action. Not all events will
populate this attribute.

additional_details.description:
This object provides additional information about the event if available.

This can include how a user performed an event as well as additional
information to correlate an event to external Keysafe logs. Not all events
have an additional_details object.  This object is only available in the
Enterprise Events.

Collection.title: Collection
Collection.description:
A collection of items, including files and folders.

Currently, the only collection available
is the `favorites` collection.

The contents of a collection can be explored in a
similar way to which the contents of a folder is
explored.

name.description: The name of the collection.

collection_type.description:
The type of the collection. This is used to
determine the proper visual treatment for
collections.

RecentItem.title: Recent Item
RecentItem.description: A recent item accessed by a user.

allOf.description: The item that was recently accessed.

interaction_type.description:
The most recent type of access the user performed on
the item.

interacted_at.description: The time of the most recent interaction.

interaction_shared_link.description:
If the item was accessed through a shared link it will appear here,
otherwise this will be null.

RetentionPolicy--Mini.title: Retention Policy (Mini)
RetentionPolicy--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a retention policy, used when
nested within another resource.

policy_name.description: The name given to the retention policy

retention_length.description:
The length of the retention policy. This length
specifies the duration in days that the retention
policy will be active for after being assigned to
content.  If the policy has A `policy_type` of
`indefinite`, the `retention_length` will also be
`indefinite`.

disposition_action.description:
The disposition action of the retention policy.
This action can be `permanently_delete`, which
will cause the content retained by the policy
to be permanently deleted, or `remove_retention`,
which will lift the retention policy from the content,
allowing it to be deleted by users,
once the retention policy time period has passed.

AssignmentCounts.title: Assignment Counts
AssignmentCounts.description: Counts of assignments within this a legal hold policy by item type

user.description: The number of users this policy is applied to

folder.description: The number of folders this policy is applied to

file.description: The number of files this policy is applied to

file_version.description: The number of file versions this policy is applied to

StoragePolicy--Mini.title: Storage Policy (Mini)
StoragePolicy--Mini.description: A mini description of a Storage Policy object

PathCollection.title: Path Collection
PathCollection.description: A list of parent folders for an item.

total_count.description: The number of folders in this list.

entries.description: The parent folders for this item

Permissions.title: Permissions
Permissions.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for an item.

can_delete.description: Specifies if the user can delete this item

can_download.description: Specifies if the user can download this item

can_invite_collaborator.description: Specifies if the user can invite collaborators to the item

can_rename.description: Specifies if the user can rename this item

can_set_share_access.description:
Specifies if the user can manage shared links for
this item

can_share.description: Specifies if the user can invite new collaborators to this item

AccessToken--Mini.title: Access Token Mini
AccessToken--Mini.description: The basics of an access token

expires_in.description: The time in seconds in seconds by which this token will expire.

token_type.description: The type of access token returned.

restricted_to.description:
The permissions that this access token permits,
providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

content.description:
An object containing the URL that can be used to actually fetch
the representation.

url_template.description:
The download URL that can be used to fetch the representation.
Make sure to make an authenticated API call to this endpoint.

This URL is a template and will require the `{+asset_path}` to
be replaced by a path. In general, for unpaged representations
it can be replaced by an empty string.

For paged representations, replace the `{+asset_path}` with the
page to request plus the extension for the file, for example
`1.pdf`.

When requesting the download URL the following additional
query params can be passed along.

* `set_content_disposition_type` - Sets the `Content-Disposition`
  header in the API response with the specified disposition type
  of either `inline` or `attachment`. If not supplied, the
  `Content-Disposition` header is not included in the response.

* `set_content_disposition_filename` - Allows the application to
  define the representation's file name used in the
  `Content-Disposition` header.  If not defined, the filename
  is derived from the source file name in Box combined with the
  extension of the representation.

info.description:
An object containing the URL that can be used to fetch more info
on this representation.

url.description:
The API URL that can be used to get more info on this file
representation. Make sure to make an authenticated API call
to this endpoint.

properties.description: An object containing the size and type of this presentation.

dimensions.description: The width by height size of this representation in pixels.

paged.description: Indicates if the representation is build up out of multiple pages

thumb.description:
Indicates if the representation can be used as a thumbnail of the
file

representation.description: Indicates the file type of the returned representation.

status.description: An object containing the status of this representation.

state.description:
The status of the representation.

* `success` defines the representation as ready to be viewed.
* `viewable` defines a video to be ready for viewing.
* `pending` defines the representation as to be generated. Retry
  this endpoint to re-check the status.
* `none` defines that the representation will be created when
  requested. Request the URL defined in the `info` object to trigger
  this generation.

File--Base.title: File (Base)
File--Base.description:
The bare basic representation of a file, the minimal
amount of fields returned when using the `fields` query
parameter.

id.description:
The unique identifier that represent a file.

The ID for any file can be determined
by visiting a file in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the url `https://*.app.box.com/files/123`
the `file_id` is `123`.

etag.description:
The HTTP etag of this file. This can be used within some API
endpoints in the `If-Match` and `If-None-Match` headers to only
perform changes on the file if (no) changes have happened.

FileVersion--Base.title: File Version (Base)
FileVersion--Base.description:
The bare basic representation of a file version, the minimal
amount of fields returned when using the `fields` query
parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier that represent a file version.

PaginationOrder.title: Pagination Order
PaginationOrder.description: The order in which a pagination is ordered

direction.description: The direction to order by, either ascending or descending

Folder--Base.title: Folder (Base)
Folder--Base.description:
The bare basic representation of a folder, the minimal
amount of fields returned when using the `fields` query
parameter.

id.description:
The unique identifier that represent a folder.

The ID for any folder can be determined
by visiting a folder in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the url `https://*.app.box.com/folders/123`
the `folder_id` is `123`.

etag.description:
The HTTP etag of this folder. This can be used within some API
endpoints in the `If-Match` and `If-None-Match` headers to only
perform changes on the folder if (no) changes have happened.

MetadataTemplateFieldOption.title: Metadata Template Field Option
MetadataTemplateFieldOption.description:
For type `enum` and `multiSelect`, one of the potential values
that can be selected.

id.description: The ID of the option

key.description: The text value of the option

EventSource.title: Event Source
EventSource.description:
The source file or folder that triggered an event in
the event stream.

item_type.description:
The type of the item that the event
represents. Can be `file` or `folder`.

item_id.description:
The unique identifier that represents the
item.

allOf.description:
The optional folder that this folder is located within.

This value may be `null` for some folders such as the
root folder or the trash folder.
The user who owns this item.

RetentionPolicy--Base.title: Retention Policy (Base)
RetentionPolicy--Base.description:
The bare basic representation of a file version, the minimal
amount of fields returned when using the `fields` query
parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier that represent a file version.

FileScope.title: File Scope
FileScope.description: A relation between a file and the scopes for which the file can be accessed

scope.description: The file scopes for the file access

allOf.description: The file for which the file can be accessed
